intro: Sphenodesme acuminata, commonly known as the sharp-pointed sphenodesme, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite, ovate leaves with serrated edges. Its flowers are clustered in umbels and typically have five petals, with a distinctive yellow-orange coloration. Sphenodesme acuminata is adapted to arid environments and thrives in well-drained soils.
